business.headline: Simone Tata, the quiet force behind Lakmé and Westside, dies at 95Simone Tata, a figure behind some of India's most recognizable retail and cosmetics brands, passed away at 95, leaving a legacy marked by innovation and leadership.

Lower lending rates ahead? From ICICI to SBI, your home loan rate checkIndia's central bank has reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points. This move is likely to influence home loan interest rates and stimulate activity across the housing and real estate sectors.

Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit in $72 billion dealNetflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film and streaming businesses, bringing the iconic studio under its control.

India's forex reserves decline for second week to $686.2 billion: ReportIndia's foreign exchange reserves fell for the second consecutive week, slipping by $1.877 billion to $686.227 billion in the week ended November 28, 2025.

Rs 1.2 lakh invested, only Rs 10,000 earned? The truth behind SIP mathsInvestors often overlook the real timeline of their investments when assessing SIP returns. Understanding the compounding effect and the actual period money stays invested can make a significant difference in evaluating returns.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as RBI cuts lending rate, offers liquidity supportThe Sensex ended at 85,712.37, up 447.05 points, while the Nifty50 settled at 26,186.45, gaining 152.70 points. Most of the broader market indices also ended the trading session on a positive note.

Victim of regulatory vacuum: Avadhut Sathe Training Academy denies allegationsSebi's interim order said the academy and its founder were running an unregistered investment advisory service under the guise of training programmes and had collected large sums of money from the public.

IndiGo flight cancellations: What passengers need to know about refundsIndiGo has informed the DGCA that full operational stabilisation is expected only by February 10, 2026, with continued cancellations anticipated until December 8.​

IndiGo crisis sends Delhi–Mumbai flight prices soaring to over Rs 80,000The Delhi–Mumbai corridor, which connects the national capital with the country's financial centre, is one of the busiest air routes globally. Any disruption on this route immediately affects business travellers, tourists, and daily commuters.

When two airlines rule the skies: Is India's aviation duopoly failing flyers?IndiGo's mass cancellations have exposed a deeper fault line in Indian aviation, where a growing duopoly means one airline's trouble can disrupt travel plans for the entire country.

Will personal loans become cheaper after the RBI's latest repo rate cut?Are borrowers finally set to get some relief as the RBI trims the repo rate by 25 basis points? Could this policy shift translate into lower personal loan rates soon? Read here.
Your FD investments to take a hit as RBI cuts repo rateIs your FD income set to shrink as banks prepare to reduce deposit rates after the RBI's rate cut? Let's have a look.

RBI reduces repo rate by 25 bps. Will your home loans get cheaper?RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said the committee unanimously agreed on the rate cut after assessing inflation trends, growth forecasts and liquidity needs.

IndiGo shares tumble 2% as mass flight cancellations continue to disrupt travel IndiGo's stock fell over 2%, trading at Rs 5,326.35 by 10 am, amid mounting concerns over ongoing mass cancellations and delays across India's busiest airports.

RBI reduces key lending rate by 25 points to 5.25%, maintains neutral stanceThe rate cut takes the repo rate down from 5.5% to 5.25%. Alongside this, the Standing Deposit Facility (SDF) rate has been adjusted to 5%, while the Marginal Standing Facility (MSF) rate and the bank rate now stand at 5.5%.

Who is Avadhut Sathe, Pune finfluencer whose trading academy got banned by SebiSebi said that Avadhut Sathe Trading Academy was running an unregistered investment advisory business disguised as education, misleading investors through selective performance claims, paid WhatsApp groups, and live market recommendations.

Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors eye RBI's MPC decisionAround 9:36 am, the Sensex was down 60 points at 85,325, while the Nifty hovered just above the 26,000 mark with a modest 11 point gain. Broader market indices were largely in the red, reflecting the nervousness ahead of the policy outcome.

RBI MPC announcement today: Will the all-time low rupee force a rate cut?Earlier this year, the RBI cut the repo rate by 100 basis points across three rounds, supported by falling inflation. But the backdrop has now shifted.

Sebi bans finfluencer Avadhut Sathe, freezes Rs 546 crore in major crackdownThe order, issued on December 4, marks a turning point in Sebi's push to clean up the finfluencer ecosystem, where many online trainers claim to offer education but end up giving specific stock tips, guidance and live trading calls without any regulatory licence.

Putin says Trump's tariff stance reflects fear of India's economic riseRussian President Putin said that the tariff actions by US President Donald Trump and concerns raised by Western nations over India's Russian oil imports reflect worry about India's rising economic influence.

entertainment.headline: Remember faces trying to fix: Sonu Sood backs IndiGo staff amid cancellation chaos Actor Sonu Sood has called on the public to treat Indigo Airlines staff with kindness and patience amid flight delays. He shared a video message in which he asked travellers to remain humble and considerate despite frustrations related to flight delays.

Ranveer Singh's flirty comment on Deepika's date night look steals the show Ranveer Singh shared a flirty comment on Deepika Padukone's date night look. The latter also shared a note on Ranveer's new film - 'Dhurandhar'.

Dhurandhar, Saiyaara, Pushpa: Why are our heroes toxic, broken, bad at boundaries A hard-hitting look at Bollywood's rising obsession with toxic, broody heroes, from Dhurandhar to Tere Ishk Mein. Why do audiences continue to romanticise red flags as passion?

Amaal Mallik's Bigg Boss 19 arc: Legacy, friendships, fights and finale Singer Amaal Mallik's journey in Bigg Boss 19 highlighted evolving friendships, rivalries, and emotional growth inside the house. He is contending against Gaurav Khanna, Farrhana Bhatt, Tanya Mittal and Pranit More for the coveted trophy.

Bigg Boss 19 Ep 104: Gaurav looks back, Farrhana cries remembering father Housemates Gaurav Khanna, Pranit More, Amaal Mallik, Farrhana Bhatt and Tanya Mittal revisit key moments ahead of the Bigg Boss 19 finale, as the series highlights emotional recaps, house dynamics and personal challenges.

Allu Arjun gave Rs 3.2 crore to Pushpa 2 victim, will extend more help: Dil Raju A year after the Pushpa 2 premiere tragedy, producer Dil Raju met the victim's father to address concerns over financial aid, confirming the assistance already provided and promising continued support.

Dhurandhar: Can Aditya Dhar-style cinema just be termed rage-bait or is it more? Dhurandhar portrays India's political trauma through unflinching violence. The film forces audiences to confront pain and seek justice beyond spectacle.

Oh. What. Fun. review: A star-powered Christmas caper that loses its way Michelle Pfeiffer leads Oh. What. Fun. in a festive film with charm and chaos. Despite strong performances, the film's script struggles to deliver emotional impact.

Balakrishna's Akhanda 2 likely to release tomorrow, Chennai theatre owner shares update Balakrishna's Akhanda 2 may release tomorrow after a Chennai theatre owner claimed issues are resolved, sparking fresh hope amid legal and financial delays.

Jay Kelly review: George Clooney's broken hero has shades of Imtiaz Ali's menRelease Date:Fri Dec 05, 2025 Jay Kelly explores a movie star dealing with lost identity and fading fame, brought to life through George Clooney's honest, vulnerable performance. The film's quiet sadness and reflective tone will connect with anyone who knows the bittersweet side of life behind the glamour.

Aryan Khan knew The Ba***ds of Bollywood would hit big: Not arrogance Aryan Khan reflects on the sustained success of his first series, discusses his approach to creativity, and hints at future projects, while The Ba***ds of Bollywood continues to attract critical and public attention.

Zeenat Aman recalls Dostana scene, calls out Amitabh's patronising stance Veteran actor Zeenat Aman reflects on the patriarchal attitudes of 1980s Bollywood through a scene from Dostana, highlighting shifts in societal views on women's rights and morality.

Prabhas receives warm welcome in Japan at special Baahubali The Epic screening Prabhas attended a special screening in Japan for the release of Baahubali: The Epic, a film combining both parts of the Baahubali saga. During the event, Prabhas expressed his gratitude and affection for his Japanese fans, marking a key moment in Indian cinema's global journey.

Archana Puran Singh films house-help's first flight: Like walking on clouds Actor Archana Puran Singh travelled to Bengaluru with her family and housekeeper Bhagyashree, marking Bhagyashree's first experience on a flight. The journey featured light-hearted interactions, family discussions, and local culinary exploration.

The Devil trailer: Darshan's new avatar and dialogues promise a mass entertainer The trailer for the much-anticipated film The Devil, starring Darshan, was released today. The film is set to arrive in cinemas on December 11, with early morning shows added for fans.

Kalamkaval review: Mammootty transforms into monster, Vinayakan anchors thrillerRelease Date:Fri Dec 05, 2025 Kalamkaval movie review: Director Jithin K Jose's crime drama, featuring Mammootty and Vinayakan, is a gripping thriller about a psychopathic killer. With exceptional performances and some delicious twists along the way, the film could have benefited from a crisper screenplay.

Why Kim Woo-bin and Shin Min-ah's love story has lasted South Korean stars Kim Woo-bin and Shin Min-ah's decade-long romance blossoms into marriage after years of loyalty, resilience and quiet love. In this week's K-fix we explore their full love story here.

Exclusive: Why Elvish Yadav isn't supporting any Bigg Boss 19 finalist We asked Bigg Boss OTT 2 winner Elvish Yadav who he thought was likely to win the ongoing season 19. Hosted by Salman Khan, the grand finale of 'Bigg Boss 19' will stream on JioHotstar at 9 pm.

Aishwarya Rai opens up on Miss World, films and why she's never felt insecure Speaking at the Red Sea Film Festival 2025, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan opened up about her career path, her measured presence on social media and her Miss World years. She also admitted that she has never faced moments of insecurity about her choices.

general news.headline: IndiGo operations 'steadily' resuming, passengers' plight reaches Supreme CourtThe Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi issued a passenger advisory, announcing that IndiGo flight operations are gradually returning to normal following the airline's disruption, which resulted in over 1,000 flight cancellations on Friday and over 550 flights on Thursday.

Delhi chokes again as air quality still very poor, temperature continues to dipOf Delhi's 39 monitoring stations, 35 registered readings in the very poor range, while the remaining four reported poor air quality.

Ex-Pentagon official says Trump deserves Nobel for uniting India and RussiaFormer Pentagon official Michael Rubin says Donald Trump deserves a Nobel Prize for bringing India and Russia closer. He also criticised Trump's handling of ties with India, which have been rocky.

Do or dew: India fight to keep history alive in Vizag deciderIND v SA, 3rd ODI preview: With dew dictating late-evening contests, India's fate could hinge as much on skill as on luck in Vizag. South Africa smell history, and KL Rahul's young bowling unit must finally deliver under the dripping pressure.

Surprising that Putin dinner invite was accepted: Congress leader slams TharoorFollowing Shashi Tharoor's invitation to attend Putin's dinner at the Rashtrapati Bhavan, Pawan Khera expressed astonishment, saying that the Congress MP should not have accepted the invitation when the leaders of his own party were not invited.

Simone Tata, the quiet force behind Lakmé and Westside, dies at 95Simone Tata, a figure behind some of India's most recognizable retail and cosmetics brands, passed away at 95, leaving a legacy marked by innovation and leadership.

Elon Musk pops the popcorn as Paramount vs Netflix for Warner Bros heats upElon Musk's reaction comes amid reports that Netflix has agreed to buy the film and streaming businesses of Warner Bros, which owns franchises such as Harry Potter and Batman. Paramount has accused Warner Bros of an unfair sale process.

Putin's Bihari MLA: Meet Abhay Kumar Singh who added Indian tadka to Russian pollsBihar-born Abhay Kumar Singh, a medical graduate from Russia, joined President Vladimir Putin's United Russia Party in 2015. He became the first Indian-origin lawmaker in Russia after winning an election in 2017. Speaking to India Today TV, he recalled how he infused Indian-style campaigning into Russian elections, which helped him secure a record-margin victory.

1,000 IndiGo flights cancelled; Centre hopes for fix by Monday, CEO says Dec 10-15IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers explained that the massive disruption was caused by the rebooting of IndiGo's entire operational system.

Live: IndiGo chaos enters Day 5, over 470 flights cancelled across India todayIndiGo Flights Cancellations Live Updates: IndiGo, India's largest airline, continued to face operational disruptions for the fourth consecutive day on Saturday, with multiple flights cancelled at major airports nationwide. On Friday alone, over 1,000 flights were grounded, adding to more than 550 cancellations reported the previous day. Meanwhile, Delhi airport on Saturday morning said that the airline's operations are gradually going back to normalcy. IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers expressed optimism that normal flight schedules will be restored by December 15. The airline earlier acknowledged that the ongoing chaos resulted from miscalculations and planning lapses during the implementation of Phase 2 of the Flight Duty Time Limitations (FDTL) rules. In response, the government has ordered a high-level inquiry to identify the root causes and hold responsible parties accountable. Stay tuned with India Today for all Live Updates.

Why PM Modi picked a Fortuner for carpool with Putin? Theories behind itPutin in India: There was a red carpet welcome, PM Modi breaking protocol to greet him on the tarmac, a firm handshake, followed by a warm hug. However, what caught the attention was PM Modi choosing a white Toyota Fortuner to carpool with Putin.

Netflix buys Warner Bros in $82.7B deal, what does it mean for youNetflix has sealed a historic $82.7 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros Discovery. This merger will transform the streaming landscape with iconic franchises joining Netflix.

Putin destroys Pak narrative, says Taliban combatting terrorismRussian President Vladimir Putin, in an exclusive interview with India Today Group, said that the Taliban in Afghanistan were a reality. He said the Taliban regime was combating terrorism. With this, Putin destroyed Islamabad's narrative of Afghan Taliban's role in terrorism in Pakistani territory, in which it tried to show an Indian role as well.

Our cosmos, continent, country and conflictNorth-based pundits, politicians, and academics have historically committed the intellectual trespass of equating the entirety of Bharat with Aryavart, despite their preceptor Manu's own Deccan delineation. In their narrative, the subcontinent becomes the exclusive, unbroken motherland of an indigenous Aryan identity.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

He is contending against Gaurav Khanna, Farrhana Bhatt, Tanya Mittal and Pranit More for the coveted trophy.

Clear Coding is the way to date in 2026. What it meansA fresh addition to the ever-growing vocabulary of modern dating, Clear Coding refers to communicating intentions openly, directly, and without mixed signals.

FIFA World Cup 2026 groups revealed: Mbappe's France, Haaland's Norway drawn togetherFIFA World Cup: The World Cup draw gave a big surprise to football fans as France and Norway were drawn together, which now sets the stage for an early Kylian Mbappe vs Erling Haaland clash in the group-stage.

EU hits Elon Musk's X with €120 million fine for violating digital rulesThe EU fined X 120 million euros for violating transparency rules under the Digital Services Act, marking its first major non-compliance ruling and triggering sharp criticism from US officials who call the move anti-speech.

From Jhol Momo to Achaari Baingan, lavish thali served at state dinner for PutinIndia showcased its rich culinary heritage with a specially curated vegetarian thali for Russian President Vladimir Putin at a state dinner hosted by President Droupadi Murmu.

He shared a video message in which he asked travellers to remain humble and considerate despite frustrations related to flight delays.

Ranveer Singh's flirty comment on Deepika's date night look steals the showRanveer Singh shared a flirty comment on Deepika Padukone's date night look. The latter also shared a note on Ranveer's new film - 'Dhurandhar'.

sports.headline: Wolvaardt smashes record-breaking ton as South Africa crush Ireland by 105 runs Laura Wolvaardt produced a record-breaking innings as South Africa defeated Ireland by 105 runs in the first T20I at Newlands. She was adjudged Player of the Match for scoring an unbeaten 115* (56) with the help of 15 fours and four sixes.

3rd ODI Live: Can Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma help India seal series in Vizag? India (IND) vs South Africa (SA) LIVE Score: India are set to take on South Africa in the third and final ODI of the three-match series in Visakhapatnam. With the series tied 1-1, both teams will be eager to give their all in the decider and seal the victory.

Shree Charani interview: Mentored by Mithali Raj, inspired by Lanning In an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, Indian left-arm spinner Charani reflected on her journey in the Women's World Cup, where she delivered some brilliant spells. She also shared her admiration for Ravindra Jadeja and how Mithali Raj played a key role in guiding her along the way.

How can all-rounders like Hardik Pandya avoid constant injuries? IND vs SA: India all-rounders Hardik Pandya and Nitish Kumar Reddy have struggled with injuries in recent times. Legendary Jacques Kallis explained how the top stars can keep themselves fresh in a packed cricket calendar.

Discus thrower Seema Punia handed 16-month ban for failing dope test Former Asian Games gold-medallist Seema Punia has been suspended for 16 months after failing a dope test, with her ban effective from November 10 as per the Anti-Doping Disciplinary Panel's decision. The National Anti-Doping Agency has not disclosed the banned substance.

Mohammed Siraj hosts Shami, Akash Deep, and Mukesh Kumar at his restaurant Mohammed Siraj hosted Mohammed Shami, Akash Deep, Mukesh Kumar and other Bengal players at his Hyderabad restaurant ahead of their Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match. Bengal are set to take on Puducherry in Hyderabad on December 6.

Do or dew: India fight to keep history alive in Vizag decider IND v SA, 3rd ODI preview: With dew dictating late-evening contests, India's fate could hinge as much on skill as on luck in Vizag. South Africa smell history, and KL Rahul's young bowling unit must finally deliver under the dripping pressure.

New Zealand vs West Indies, 1st Test Day 5 Live Score and Updates from Christchurch NZ vs WI, 1st Test Day 5: New Zealand stay ahead but lose key bowlers, and Windies still have work to do. With Hope and Greaves resuming, the final day promises a thrilling finish with every result in play.

FIFA World Cup 2026 groups revealed: Mbappe's France, Haaland's Norway drawn together FIFA World Cup: The World Cup draw gave a big surprise to football fans as France and Norway were drawn together, which now sets the stage for an early Kylian Mbappe vs Erling Haaland clash in the group-stage.

Wearing 16, Prince Deep pulls a Sreejesh to power India to Junior WC semis In Sreejesh's iconic No.16 jersey, young keeper Princedeep Singh delivered a breakout performance, making clutch saves in the shootout as India edged Belgium to reach the Junior World Cup semifinals.

Donald Trump awarded FIFA Peace prize at 2026 World Cup drawFIFA World Cup 2026: US President Donald Trump received the inaugural FIFA Peace Prize during the 2026 World Cup draw ceremony. FIFA says the award recognises his efforts to promote global peace and diplomatic engagement.

IND vs SA, 3rd ODI Predicted XI: How will India handle the Washington Sundar issue?IND vs SA: With the series tied 1–1, India face key selection questions ahead of the Vizag decider. Washington Sundar's role and Prasidh Krishna's form are under scrutiny as the team looks to fix its finishing and bowling balance.

India desperate to win ODI series vs South Africa: Assistant coach Ryan ten DoeschateIND vs SA: India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate emphasised that the team is carrying a sense of desperation to win the ODI series against the Proteas, and will go all-out in the Vizag decider to turn their fate around.

Joe Root on maiden Ashes century Down Under: Clear plans, backing current formJoe Root finally ends a 12-year wait for an Ashes century in Australia with an unbeaten 135 at the Gabba, lifting England from 5 for 2 and reminding the cricket world why his clarity and class endure.

After Commonwealth Games, Ahmedabad to host Olympics in 2036, says Amit ShahAmit Shah says Ahmedabad should prepare for a bigger global stage as he expresses confidence the city will secure the 2036 Olympics after winning the 2030 Commonwealth Games, with major venues already rising.

What is Washington Sundar's role in India's ODI side? India coach reveals key detailsIND vs SA, 3rd ODI: India sheds light on Washington Sundar's evolving ODI role as the all-rounder sharpens his late overs batting and adapts to match-up based bowling demands, leaving his impact in the decider one to watch.

India rout Ireland 4-0 at Junior Women's World Cup as Purnima Yadav nets bracePurnima Yadav's stellar brace powered India to a commanding 4-0 win over Ireland at the Junior Women's World Cup. The dominant victory sealed a confident finish to their Pool C campaign in Santiago.

Shah Rukh Khan suggested Russel's power coach role: KKR CEO Venky MysoreKKR CEO Venky Mysore revealed that Shah Rukh Khan played a key role in guiding Andre Russell towards his new role in the team. The emotional decision marks the end of a 12-year purple-and-gold journey for the West Indies all-rounder.

Has Virat Kohli ever hit a hat-trick of centuries in ODIs? Vizag awaits his next actIND vs SA, 3rd ODI: All eyes turn to Kohli in Vizag as whispers of a rare ODI feat swirl again, though whether he's crossed that mark before remains part of the intrigue.

No more day-night ODIs in India? Assistant coach discusses massive dew problemRyan ten Doeschate believes adjusting ODI start times could help India counter the heavy dew factor. Ahead of the Vizag decider, the batting coach says conditions, not effort, have created the widening gap between batting first and second.

Pink-ball Test: Clinical Australia punish sloppy England to edge ahead on Day 2England's first 300-run total in Ashes pink-ball Test could not secure advantage at Gabba. Poor bowling and fielding allowed Australia to take a crucial lead on Day 2.

12 ISL clubs urge AIFF for resolution by December 8, warn delays could hurt leagueISL clubs warn the AIFF that without clarity on the league's commercial framework by December 8, further delays could deepen financial strain and jeopardise the stability of India's top-tier football structure.

Smriti shares first post after wedding delay, fans spot missing engagement ringSmriti Mandhana ends social media silence with a toothpaste promotional video. Fans notice her missing engagement ring sparking questions about the shoot timing.

Kallis says SA20 gives South Africa perfect World Cup prep: Is India missing a trick?With the SA20 ending days before the World Cup and India taking a different route, how these contrasting build-ups shape the 2026 tournament remains to be seen.

Pakistan's Fakhar Zaman fined by ICC for on-field antics at Tri-series finalShaheen Afridi and Mohammad Nawaz claimed three wickets each to engineer Sri Lanka's dramatic collapse, before Babar Azam led a measured chase to secure Pakistan's six-wicket victory in the Tri-Series final at Rawalpindi.

IND vs SA: Nandre Burger and Tony de Zorzi set for injury scans ahead of Vizag ODIIND vs SA: South Africa face an anxious wait on Nandre Burger and Tony de Zorzi ahead of the Vizag decider. Their scan results could shape team balance in the must-win ODI against India.

South Africa's team balance will help against hungry India in Vizag ODI: BreetzkeIND vs SA: South Africa's rising star Matthew Breetzke believes their balanced batting unit gives them an edge against a hungry India in the Visakhapatnam decider. With the series tied, both teams brace for a high-pressure showdown.

Josh Hazlewood's Ashes return in jeopardy after pacer develops Achilles sorenessJosh Hazlewood's hopes of playing in the Ashes 2025-26 suffer a setback due to Achilles soreness during rehab. Australia are suffering from injuries to both Hazlewood and captain Pat Cummins.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi is India's most searched as cricket tops Google trends in 2025Google Year in Search 2025 placed Vaibhav Suryavanshi at the top of India's trends. The 14-year-old batter's breakout season matched his soaring public attention. Cricketers and cricket tournaments dominated the trends this year. Here's all that you need to know.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
